name: 01-Project Overview
content:
Credit Fraud Detection


Project Overview:

The goal of the Credit Fraud Detection App is to identify and prevent fraudulent transactions using machine learning-driven fraud prediction models. By analyzing transactional, demographic, and merchant data, the system flags unusual behaviors that may indicate fraud. This enables secure and efficient decision-making in credit and lending operations.

Approach:

The workflow integrates end-to-end machine learning practices:

  1. Data Profiling – Understanding raw transaction data distributions.
  2. Exploratory Analysis – Examining fraud patterns by state, demographics, and sector.
  3. Feature Engineering – Creating transaction frequency and behavior-based risk indicators.
  4. Model Training – Training an H2O Distributed Random Forest (DRF) model on labeled data.
  5. Prediction – Applying the trained or pre-trained model to classify transactions as fraud/non-fraud.
  6. Visualization & Insights – Delivering dashboards that show fraud risk trends and actionable insights.

Significance:

Fraudulent transactions are a significant financial risk, eroding trust, and profitability. Early fraud detection helps minimize financial losses, safeguard customers, and ensure compliance with security and regulatory standards.

Benefits:

  • Smart Fraud Detection: Leverages H2O DRF to detect suspicious transactions in real-time.
  • End-to-End Workflow: From raw data profiling to prediction and fraud insights.
  • Granular Insights: Explore fraud by year, state, job sector, and demographic breakdowns.
  • User-Friendly App: Simple UI to upload data, train models, and generate fraud predictions.

Expected Outcomes:

  • Accurate classification of fraudulent vs. non-fraudulent transactions.
  • Yearly, state-wise, and demographic fraud trend reports.
  • Improved fraud prevention strategies through early detection.
  • Reduced false positives while maintaining high fraud capture rates.
